trustfund:
TF039747-PAPUA NEW GUINEA -  SAL III -
            STRUCTURAL REFORM,TF039787-PAPUA NEW GUINEA - STRUCTURAL
            REFORM IN PNG,TF040692-PAPUA NEW GUINEA: GOVERNANCE
            PROMOTION ADJUSTMENT LOAN

abstracts.cdata!:
The Governance Promotion Adjustment Loan
            (GPAL) for Papua New Guinea is examined in the Inspection
            Panel Report and Recommendation and Request for Inspection.
            The GPAL made to Papua New Guinea is US$90 million, released
            over 3 years with the intention of aiding the stabilization
            and structural reform efforts of the government. The
            Request, submitted by the Center of Environmental Law and
            Community Rights, Inc (CELCOR) claims that the Management
            plans to release the last amount of the loan money despite
            the fact that the Government has not complied with
            disbursement conditions related to forestry management. The
            Panel finds that the Bank's actions were in compliance
            with the policies and procedures set forth and that adverse
            effects suffered by the Requesters were in no way related to
            the GPAL.
